relationships.description: Brockman assembled and edited contributions from 25 leading thinkers on AI
Wiener's work on cybernetics forms the historical foundation for many discussions

analysis.purpose: To present diverse perspectives on artificial intelligence and its implications for humanity
analysis.significance: Comprehensive examination of AI by leading thinkers across multiple disciplines

notable_quotes: "Artificial intelligence is today's storyâ€”the story behind all other stories. It is the Second Coming and the Apocalypse at the same time: Good AI versus evil AI."
"We must cease to kiss the whip that lashes us."
"The machine's danger to society is not from the machine itself but from what man makes of it."
red_flags: Potential for AI to exceed human control
Loss of human employment to automation

blackmail_indicators.description: Document is an academic discussion of AI ethics and philosophy, no blackmail or coercion elements present

illegal_activity.description: Document contains philosophical and scientific discussion about AI, no first-hand illegal activity

details: References to media coverage of AI
Discussion of how AI is portrayed in popular culture

public_knowledge.context: Book published by Penguin Press in 2019, intended for public consumption

analysis.summary: This document is an excerpt from John Brockman's 2019 book 'Deep Thinking: Twenty-Five Ways of Looking at AI,' featuring contributions from 25 leading scientists and thinkers examining artificial intelligence from philosophical, ethical, and technical perspectives, with Norbert Wiener's 'The Human Use of Human Beings' as a foundational reference point for discussing AI's promises and perils.
